name: O'Hara's Restaurant and Pub
address: 120 Cedar St, New York, NY 10006, USA

reviews.text: great spot. worth going for sure. fine your cities services badge or bring your own and they will let you staple it to the wall!!!

La atenciÃ³n exelente y el ambiente tambiÃ©n
Es tipo taberna
Super nice and cozy place, very nice food and atmosphere, you gonna like it!
Great Guiness, quality burger, friendly service, nice atmosphere
Love it!
Le pur pub!!!! Ambiance extraordinaire!!!!la biÃ¨re y est bonne les burgers ğŸ¤©ğŸ¤©ğŸ¤©ğŸ¤©
Atmosphere is amazing. Food is beautiful!

What a privilege to visit. Staff extremely friendly and helpful by being willing to discuss the history and impact they shared with first responders on 9/11 and the many years of cleanup and construction that followed.
Every dish was cooked to perfection.
Called in for a drink to take in this special atmosphere
TrÃ¨s bien,  je recommande

We went there big group of friends and EVERYTHING we ordered was 10 out of 10!!!
But my favorite is their Reuben and fries !!
Our favorite restaurant.
great little find good and service

Tall big grumpy guy with grey beard RUDE RUDE RUDE. Rude to everyone sitting at the bar. Told us to close out because he was leaving. My husband and I both work in the industry, there are plenty of nicer ways to get some to close out. The other bartender, young black kid, looked like he didnâ€™t even want to be there. Not attentive at all. Beer was good ğŸ‘
Cool bar next th the firehouse at the 9/11 memorial

One of the best Irish pub in NYC. It's so cozy and relaxing. The perfect atmosphere. Service was fantastic and the food is so good. Generous portions of food at reasonable prices. O'Hara's is the kind of place you want to visit again and again. When you find yourself downtown, O'Hara's is the place to go for food and drinks.

Oâ€™Haraâ€™s Restaurant and Pub is a lively spot offering hearty American fare, great drinks, and a welcoming pub atmosphere. The menu features generous portions of classic favorites, and the service is friendly and efficient. Whether youâ€™re stopping in for a meal, drinks with friends, or to catch a game, itâ€™s a reliable place for good food and good times.

Visiting
WTC
Sit down, grab a pint, and ask for the â€œbookâ€ Read about the history of this place and the Heroes of NYC. Never Forget!
Went here for lunch last week after our memorial tour, and really enjoyed it! Great food and great service. The guys took good care of us.

The guy who served us was an asset to Oâ€™Haraâ€™s and The United States, friendly, knowledgeable, sensibly priced food and drink, super location -> 911 memorial & Freedom Tower next door, Fire House #EngineCompany10 next door too! â¤ï¸â¤ï¸

Super pub Irlandese sotto al One world trader center.
Birre ottime ,cibo buono e ambiente classico dei pub anglosassoni.
Consigliato
Lugar diferente con mucho encanto. La bebida y comida correcta. Recomendable
This place is near 9/11 Memorial.  It has thousands of first responders badges stapled everywhere. A tribute to first responders everywhere.
Good food ğŸ’¯â€¦
Meiner Meinung nach 1 bar, die man in New York rum bedingt besuchen muss freundliche Bedienung geiles Ambiente Nutzung fehlen. Preisleistung, sensationell

No better place to go immediately after visiting the WTC area and Museum than O'Hara's! It was a rumor, I believed it, tested it and it was, in fact, true! You feel like you are almost walking into a time capsule the moment you see the door and I won't spoil the surprise by telling you what happens AFTER you open the door.

It is a beautiful spot with so much personality, friendly service and the biggest burger I have ever seen. I couldn't even finish HALF. I think there was an entire pack of pack on it. ;) It was SO good.

Not to mention, really reasonably priced, especially considering it would have fed me three times. I was able to swap out reg fries for sweet potato fries (always a win). The photos of the HAND-WRITTEN menu will tell you everything about the vibe of this unique place..... And the prices are on them. Those portions are HUGE, people! Enjoy!

Will definitely be back!
French onion soup and chicken cesar wrap were so good! Great atmosphere, friendly staff!
Fun irish/dive bar.
Tolles Pub in der NÃ¤he vom 9/11 Memorial. Gutes Essen und tolle AtmosphÃ¤re! Die Dekoration ist einmalig!
Endroit accueillant avec une chouette ambiance Ã  deux pas du World Trade center.
Perfect place to stop in for a drink!

Havenâ€™t got to eat there yet, but the owners are great kind hearted people. They are kind to active duty, veterans, our firefighters, and our police. Thank you for your kindness, hope to see yâ€™all upon returning to NY

You can tell this location takes pride in its location. They are less than a block from the former location of the trade center buildings. They have hung police and fire patches on just about every spot on the walls. When we first arrived they said it would be 10 to 15 minutes but it was only about 5 minutes.

The food was good and filled a big hole I had in my stomach. I enjoyed my burger and my wife enjoyed hers as well. Even our picky son enjoyed his food.

Overall this was a great place for lunch, they provided great service and great food.

Great pub in downtown Manhatthan
Beer good
Locals and tourists drinking
Food nice.
Great place
First time visitor to NY
Great friendly staff and food. The owner was very friendly and cares for the community as well as visitors.  Made us feel welcome and like we part of the family.
Restaurante muy chulo con una comida muy buena

His is a great little Irish pub. The food and service are both excellent. I'd easily suggest this place.  The fact it's so popular with the locals and those who work nearby is evidence this is a great place.
Preis Leistung gut. Freundliche Mitarbeiter. Ein schÃ¶ner Ort zum genieÃŸen .

Oâ€™Haraâ€™s is a classic spot. The foodâ€™s solid, the drinks are cold, and the vibe is easygoing and friendly. Itâ€™s got that true pub feel â€” relaxed, welcoming, and full of good energy. The staff are great, and itâ€™s the kind of place you can hang out for hours. Perfect for grabbing a bite, a beer, and catching up with friends
Don't miss this NYC authentic pub.
Good atmosphere and well priced. The Food is okay and the beer awesome. Great place to hang out.
ğŸ‘ŒğŸ‘ŒğŸ‘Œ
The food was amazing, love the vibe. Service was friendly and fast despite being busy. Look forward to coming back.

Came here for lunch after visiting the 9/11 Museum. Small place a block away from the site. Service was outstanding and the food was delicious. Great place to have lunch after hours of touring. Highly recommend.

If you a looking for a cold beer and a friendly atmosphere - this is the place! I have been here a few times now and I love the pub style food. It is always easy to find someone to have a chat with if you sit at the bar.
Las galletas son caras pero hay que probarlas

Miejsce warte uwagi zwiedzajÄ…c Nowy Jork!
Pyszne piwo, klimat i miejsce z tradycjÄ….
Polecam kaÅ¼demu!

Great place for a cheap beer! Great service! Really nice atmosphere!
The food I dont know, normally just take a beer there.

Fantastyczne miejsce. Co roku w rocznicÄ™ 11 09 sÄ… tu tÅ‚umy wspominjÄ…ce i oddajÄ™ce hoÅ‚d ofiarom tych atakÃ³w.
W srodku wiele emblematÃ³w roÅ¼nych jednostek czy to policji, straÅ¼y, wojska z wielu krajÃ³w. SÄ… teÅ¼ Polskie emblematy. Jedzenie super i miÅ‚a obsÅ‚uga . Mozna kupiÄ‡ koszulke pamiÄ…tkowa.

We had such a wonderful time at O'Hara's Restaurant and Pub! Everyone was incredibly kind, attentive, and made us feel right at home. The atmosphere is warm and family-like â€” we truly enjoyed every moment. Weâ€™ll definitely be back in December, this time with a badge in our bag!
Had a great time at Oâ€™Haraâ€™s Pub! The Guinness was perfectly poured, the staff were quick and friendly, and the burger was awesome. Highly recommend for anyone visiting downtown Manhattan.

Ein super cooler Pub der bis unter die Decke mit Patches von allen mÃ¶glichen Polizeien, Feuerwehren weltweit dekoriert ist. Auch wir haben uns verewigt. Essen absolut top, war u.a. das beste Philly Cheesesteak des ganzen USA Aufenthaltes.

Fuimos de casualidad, ya que estaba al lado del hotel y habia leido que era un sitio muy autentico, bien de precio respecto a los precios de NY y buena comida. Y no decepciono!

El pollo, en diferentes vertientes de platos estaba excelente. Los camareros genial. Alguno habla espaÃ±ol.

Sitio recomendado
Bardzo fajny klimat  knajpka usytowana bardzo blisko Memorial WTC. Bardzo duzo emblematic ratownikoÊ»w z caÅ‚ego Å›wiata. Nawet znalazÅ‚am polskie. Jedzoonko smakowite. A ceny teÅ¼ spoko jak na NY.

Great find on the way from 9/11 Memorial. Good selection of drinks, friendly service and great atmosphere. Fantastic choice of rock music. I've been living in London for the last 18 years and I have to say none of my favourite bars there have such a great music. I know, it's very personal but... Going to visit again at the nearest opportunity.

Mozzarella cheeseburger was good. Table was a bit too small to be comfortable. Great tribute to all Fire/EMS/Police, with patches and stickers lining the doors, ceiling ,and walls. This was especially good for this location so close to the 911 memorial. Bring a patch to add from your station and an appetite.

Stopped in for a pint and apps. My son said to ask to see the binder. Everything changed. I felt I was on hallowed ground. The pictures of 9-11 and the tributes to our heros touched me greatly. In addition, all the patches on the walls from first responders all over the country made this place special. We have said, "Never Forget." There are times, unfortunately, when it seems we have. I raise a pint to our brave heros. God bless your sacrifice.

I stopped by O'Hara's for a quick drink on a Saturday afternoon. It was around 12 PM and it was already pretty busy.

Fortunately I found a seat at the bar, and immediately felt at home. The staff here are very warm and friendly. The walls are filled with police and firefighter patches, along with tons of 9/11 decor. This isn't surprising since O'Hara's is literally next to ground zero.

I'll definitely return and try the food. It looks delicious!

We were looking for a place to eat and found this place after touring the 9-11 memorial. Loved the atmosphere and all the patches displayed on the walls and ceilings honoring 1st responders. Food and service was great! So glad we stopped in.

After visiting 9/11 memorial or the One World trade center this is a good place for lunch. The interior is covered with badges from police and fire departments from all over the USA and even from other countries.
We had the O'hara classic burger which was quite good.
Would fully recommend eating at this restaurant.

O'Hara's Restaurant and Pub is a beloved Irish pub and sports bar located in the heart of New York

City's Financial District. Situated at 120 Cedar St, New York, NY 10006, this cozy spot offers a warm and inviting atmosphere, perfect for catching a game, enjoying a hearty meal, or simply relaxing with friends.

Their menu features a wide variety of classic Irish and American pub fare, including shepherd's pie, fish and chips, burgers, and salads. They also offer a range of vegetarian options, happy hour specials, and a full bar.

O'Hara's has received rave reviews, with a 4.6-star rating from over 4,300 reviews on Google 1. They're open Monday through Thursday from 11:00 AM to 1:00 AM, Friday from 11:00 AM to 1:00 AM, Saturday from 11:00 AM to 1:00 AM, and Sunday from 12:00 PM to 12:00 AM.

O'Hara's is not only known for its delicious food and drinks but also for its rich history and tribute to first responders. The pub's walls are adorned with patches from fire departments around the world, making it a must-visit spot for those looking to pay their respects.

Fantastyczne miejsce na mapie NYC. Klimat jaki tam panuje jest nie do podrobienia. Naszywki i emblematy sÅ‚uÅ¼b na Å›cianach tworzÄ… super atmosferÄ™. ZnaleÅºliÅ›my nawet nasza polskÄ… PolicjÄ™! Polecamy!

Good evening, I know I'm supposed to review the place, but I'm actually trying to inquir about shirts that you used to sell about 10 years ago Your email online isn't valid so I thought Id try this. My wife has one of your shirts and it's getting to be worn out (it's one of her favorites). I was wondering if you still sell them, and if do if you ship them? I would like to surprise her with a new one! Thank you so much for your help.  Looking forward to hearing from you.

Regards, Morgan

The place is really cool. The food is delicious and very worth the dÃ©tour.

As a french guy, the amount of food was too generous but really good

If you're looking for a cozy and welcoming spot with great food and a laid-back vibe, O'Hara's Restaurant and Pub is the place to be. From the moment I walked in, I was impressed by the warm, pub-like atmosphere â€“ it feels like you're in a friendly neighborhood hangout, but with the kind of service and quality food that youâ€™d expect from a top-tier establishment.

I started with their classic Irish soda bread, which was freshly baked and served with creamy butter â€“ the perfect way to kick off the meal. For my main course, I went with the fish and chips, and it did not disappoint! The fish was crispy on the outside, tender and flaky on the inside, and the fries were golden and perfectly seasoned. My friend had the shepherdâ€™s pie, and she couldnâ€™t stop raving about how hearty and flavorful it was.

The staff at O'Hara's is absolutely wonderful â€“ our server was friendly, knowledgeable, and made great recommendations. The pub also has a fantastic selection of beers, including a few local brews, which complemented our meal perfectly.

Whether youâ€™re looking for a casual dinner or a place to hang out with friends, O'Hara's Restaurant and Pub is a must-visit. Itâ€™s the kind of place that makes you feel right at home with delicious food and excellent service.

An NYC institution and I get the hype. Packed even on a weekday, with a chicken sandwich that deserves its own zip code. Guinness on tap tasted like liquid gold. Friendly crowd, good energy, and food thatâ€™ll make you cuss in joy. Bless this chaotic pub paradise. ğŸºğŸ”¥

Great dive bar. Paul is a great bartender and unofficial tour guide and story teller. Every time I go to nyc, here is my first stop. Great ales and the food is surprisingly good for a dive bar. Excellent place all around and very historical as it relates to 911.

Der Pub war in unmittelbarer NÃ¤he zu unserem Hotel. Sehr urig und gemÃ¼tliches Ambiente. Netter und zuvorkommend Service. Wir haben relativ lange auf das Essen gewartet. Zwiebelsuppe und Burger waren lecker. Empfehlenswert.

Zu den Preisen auf der Karte kamen noch Tax und Servicecharge pro Person dazu (70 $ statt 55 $). Das Ambiente ist es wert.

I absolutely loved my visit here. The bar staff are so friendly and welcoming even went out of their way to make room for me when it was crazy crowded. Yummy bar food and drinks, fun atmosphere and let me have a look at their photo book from the 9/11 tragedy ğŸ©µ don't miss a visit here it's in the heart of the beautiful Financial District.

This place!  We have been here a number of times with friends, always a hit, never disappoints.  Atmosphere is warm and friendly, burgers are the best, big fat and cooked to order.  Over all the menu isâ€¦well, Irish pub!!
The beer list, tap and bottles is extensive but the Guinness pour is a show stopper, ya canâ€™t have just one.  Service is exceptional, prompt loose and friendly.
For great food, exceptional beer and cocktails served cheerfully at a reasonable price by really good peopleâ€¦get here.
The atmosphere is contemporary firehouse. Signs, patches, shirts and hats from civil servants nationwide.  It isnâ€™t a theme, it is the essence of the place!  Simply outstanding.

Dropped in around midday for some food and drink after spending some time around lower manhattan and ground zero.  Plenty of space, family friendly, simple food that all in the party will eat.   Service was efficient and courteous.

Lots of firefighter / emergency services patches and memorabilia here with it being next door to ground zero and the firefighter memorial wall.

Overall an ideal place for a quick snack and a pint for you and the family when mooching about  in NY.

Great Irish pub.

Was full when we got there but we were seated quick enough.

We got wings, salad and toasties with fries.  Everything was great, the service was very nice and efficient etc.

The cheese on the ham cheese toasty would never be served in an Irish pub, but it brought me back to my childhood, so was authentic in its own way, haha. I didnâ€™t dare try a Guinness, but the other beer was good.

An amazing bar and restaurant and a slice of American history. Please stop in and have a beer and try some of the great food. Ask  to see the book if interested in the history of 9/11. The owner is great. Walks around chatting and making you feel at home. Definitely one of my favorites on our trip to New York

The O'Hara's is not just an Irish pub, it is an institution that served  as the HQ for man forces that came here to help in the aftermath of the 9/11 event.
Here you will find lots of memorabilia as lots of Fire men, policemen, army force, etc brigades from all around the world send their badges.
The place is literally covered from floor to ceiling in memorabilia.
This is well worth a visit and the food was also really good. We would definitely come back here if in the region.

Luckily popped in! What a place. Owner was v friendly. Found us a place at the bar. Had a good chat and showed us the 9/11 memorabilia that he has from the day. Incredible. Drinks are reasonably prices too!

I think this place has been visited by every emergency service in the USA and beyond, the walls and ceilings are decorated with patches and flags, a truly amazing place.
Great selection of food and service was as you would expect...... Fast and with a smile.
Definitely worth a shot.
Todo excelente. Buen trato y buena comida en un ambiente que trae muchos recuerdos que no debemos olvidar para que no vuelvan a ocurrir.

This establishment was amazing to experience! The memorial to all of our brave men and women around the country! If you have a chance, please take the time to look through the Bible. It was super emotional, but very worth the look! Service was fantastic, despite being packed full of patrons, both local and not! 10/10 guys!

Low key and comfortable atmosphere. Good food. This bar has served countless first responders and is located just across from where the twin towers stood. There is commemoration of 9/11 all over the bar. There was just a deep sense of reverence and camaraderie. Thankful I got to spend time at this bar.

This pub is a must-visit place in NYCâ€™s Financial District as it has great vibes and friendly staff, specially at the bar. Itâ€™s spacious with so many booths, tables, high chairs and bar seats. Many comfort food options and of course good selection of beer on tap.

It also has a lot of history to it; they have even created a story book for 9/11 tragedy and all the firefighters who came to help and how this pub was damaged and the story of repairing and bringing it back to life.

I am so glad we decided to come to O'Hara's for lunch! I had the 10 house Burger and my friend had a club wrap with onion rings; both delicious! The host was very funny and jovial and really made the place lively! The history at O'Hara's is touching and something worth seeing especially if you've ever worked in public safety. The FDNY firefighter memorial is right next to it and it is also something to visit.
In una serata di pioggia, alle 9.15 pm, questa birreria ci ha salvato facendoci assaggiare degli ottimi hamburger e delle birre super!

I'm really glad I visited O'Hara's whilst touring the financial district in lower manhatten.
The place is adorned with badges from all manner of  emergency services ( first responders ) and is a fitting tribute to those that run into danger.
They have a book. If they ask you if you'd like to see it, then I would say take the opportunity if you have the time.
It catalogues the events of 9/11, and whilst it's an extraordinarily emotional document they have put together,  it's also a beacon of hope for the future.
I'm glad I was given the opportunity.
I love the fact that if you set up a tab they give you a proper piece of paper that they put into the lovely old fashioned till and stamp to update your bill each time you ask for more ( see my pictures ).
I should also add that I accidentally left a bag behind on the evening I spent there.
I returned the next morning, and sure enough, it was there for me to collect.
The food was nice and the staff were brilliant.

One of the best bars to visit if you or your loved one is in law enforcement. Bring a badge from your town and staple it up or just admire how many have came before you.

The guy at the door was great and helped us find a large space in the back.

They also have great reasonably priced tshirts.  Must stop if you like cop bars and are near the trade center.

Service was quick!
